meanings.definition: The quality or state of being squalid.
meanings.sent1: The squalidness of the alley was evident from the overflowing trash cans.
meanings.sent2: The squalidness of the abandoned house made it clear it had been neglected for years.
meanings.sent3: Despite the squalidness of the situation, they managed to find humor in the chaos.
meanings.sent4: The squalidness of the room was a stark reminder of the need for cleanliness.
meanings.sent5: The squalidness of the pond was so extreme that even the ducks avoided it.

meanings.sent1: The squalidness of the streets was a result of poor city maintenance.
meanings.sent2: Living in squalidness can have a negative impact on one's health.
meanings.sent3: The squalidness of the cafeteria made the students opt for packed lunches.
meanings.sent4: The squalidness of the situation was a wake-up call for the community to take action.
meanings.sent5: The squalidness of the hotel room was so bad that they had to switch rooms immediately.
